intro: Laserpitium angustissimum, commonly known as the narrowleaf hawk's-beard, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows in alpine and subalpine environments, preferring well-drained soils and full sunlight. Its narrow, grass-like leaves and yellow flowers are adapted to withstand harsh, cold climates. Laserpitium angustissimum is often found in rocky or gravelly habitats at high elevations.
